titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: Beyond my correspondence, and some desultory reading, I did nothing, and finally had to retire to bed without dinner. For the heavy cold which has burdened me for the last few days, now seemed to be taking a graver form, so that the cowardly course of prudence commanded itself irresistibly by the full argument of physical weakness.
